bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, September 15, 1952

div1.p: Siler informs Hench that he requested that Love send him the names and addresses of the officers of the Walter Reed Memorial Association. He inquires if Hench is going to the dedication of Camp Lazear and hopes that he will be in Washington so there can be a meeting of the Association.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, September 15, 1952
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
-----
GORGAS MEMORIAL LABORATORY
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
September 15, 1952
JOSEPH F. SILER
PRESIDENT
MAURICE H. THATCHER
VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL
WALTER A. BLOEDORN
SECRETARY
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
This is a somewhat belated acknowledgement of your note of Sep-
tember 9th requesting that I send you by air mail the names and
addresses of the officers of the Walter Reed Memorial Association
which you desired to send to Dr. Nogueira of Havana, Cuba.

In view of the fact that General Love now has all the records
of the Walter Reed Memorial Association, I telephone to him con-
cerning your request. He advised me by telephone that he would send
the names to you immediately and doubtless you received them without
delay.

I trust that you had a nice leave which I know you very greatly
deserved. I am wondering if it is your intention to go down to
Havana for the dedication of the Lazear Park. We are hoping that
you will be coming east some time this fall and that it will be pos-
sible for you to come by Washington for a day in order that we may
have a meeting of the Association and have the pleasure of seeing
you again.

As I wrote you recently, it was necessary for me to go into
hospital for a few days by I am beginning to feel all right again
now.
div1.closer:
Faithfully yours, J. F. Siler
Col., (MC), USA, Rtd. jfs k
